ETYMOLOGY: From Old French secte, from Latin secta 'a path, a way, a school of thought,' originally 'a course of action or thought,' from feminine past participle of sequi 'to follow'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A group of people with somewhat different religious beliefs (typically regarded as heretical or schismatic) from those of a larger group to which they belong.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 从一个较大的宗教组织中分离出来的小团体，通常信仰有所不同，常被视为异端或分裂。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He was excommunicated for joining a fundamentalist sect.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他因加入一个原教旨主义教派而被逐出教会。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A group of people forming a distinct unit within a larger body, especially in philosophy or politics, holding particular doctrines or opinions.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 在较大的团体内部形成一个独特单位的一群人，尤其指哲学或政治领域，持有特定学说或观点。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The leader of that political sect was very influential among his followers.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 那个政治派别的领导人对他的追随者非常有影响力。

REGISTER: Formal or neutral, sometimes with a negative connotation when referring to religious groups seen as deviating from the norm.
